medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute lower abdominal pain for three days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports a sudden onset of sharp lower abdominal pain that has been constant for three days without radiation. He has experienced decreased appetite and has not had a bowel movement since the pain started, although he has passed gas less than usual. He also reported a fever of 101.0 degrees two days prior to presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prostate cancer s/p radical prostatectomy, bladder cancer s/p TURBT, anxiety, asbestosis (cough with white phlegm), hypertension (HTN), hyperlipidemia (HLD), type 2 diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died from brain hemorrhage and diabetes; father also diabetic, died from myocardial infarction at an unspecified age; one brother with diabetes.
